summary: This is an email from a Federal Bureau of Prisons official, sent on August 11, 2019, relaying a message from the NYC Medical Examiner's office regarding the need to verify Jeffrey Epstein's body before an autopsy can begin. It indicates official procedures following Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose body is at the coroner's office and requires verification before an autopsy can begin.

persons.name: Elizabeth Kubler-Ross
persons.context: Her quote is included in the email signature of the sender.

events.title: Notification of Epstein's Death and Need for Body Verification
events.description: The NYC Medical Examiner's office contacts the Bureau of Prisons at 6:42am, requesting someone to come to the coroner's office to verify inmate Jeffrey Epstein's body so an autopsy can begin.

locations: NYC Medical Examiner's office / coroner's office
MCC New York, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is dated August 11, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his jail cell.
The NYC Medical Examiner's office called at 6:42am requesting official verification of Epstein's body before an autopsy could proceed.
The email originates from a Federal Bureau of Prisons official, indicating official inter-agency communication following the death.
The body was at the coroner's office, confirming the location for the autopsy.
